abstract.text: A request to create a new Photos asset from underlying data resources, for use in a photo library change block.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object, used within a photo library change block, constructs a new photo or video asset from data resources, and adds it to the Photos library. This class works in terms of the raw data resources that together form an asset, so you can use it together with the
class to perform a complete copy (or backup and restore) of an asset’s underlying resources. To instead simply create a new asset from an image object, image file, or video file, see the superclass
To create a new asset from data resources, first start a change block using the shared
Within the change block, create a new asset creation request with the
Add image, video, or data resources using the methods in the Providing Data Resources for the New Asset section below.
(Optional.) Set metadata for the new asset using methods and properties of the superclass
After Photos runs the change block and calls your completion handler, the new asset is created in the Photos library.
If you instantiate or use this class outside a photo library change block, Photos throws an exception. For details on change blocks, see

abstract.text: Adopt the latest privacy enhancements to deliver advanced user-privacy controls.

doc://com.apple.photokit/documentation/P.title: Delivering an Enhanced Privacy Experience in Your Photos App

abstract.text: Work with image and video assets that the Photos app manages, including those from iCloud Photos and Live Photos.
A request to create, delete, change metadata for, or edit the content of a Photos asset, for use in a photo library change block.
A request to create a new Photos asset from underlying data resources, for use in a photo library change block.
Adds a data resource to the asset being created, using the specified data.
Adds a data resource to the asset being created, using the file at the specified URL.
Creates a request for adding a new asset to the Photos library using asset resources.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether Photos supports creating an asset with the specified combination of resource types.
An underlying data resource associated with a photo, video, or Live Photo asset in the Photos library.
A set of options affecting the creation of a new Photos asset from underlying resources.
A resource manager for the data storage underlying a Photos asset.
A set of options affecting the delivery of underlying asset data that you request from the asset resource manager.
An object that manages access and changes to the user’s photo library.
Asynchronously runs a block that requests changes to the photo library.
Synchronously runs a block that requests changes to be performed in the photo library.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
